resources.string:
This demo demonstrates the off-screen feature.

1. Draw off-screen and see your drawing to the right.
2. On the buttom right corner of the virtual screen there is a button. Hover above it at different heights to change the opacity of the circle.\n\n3. Press it to change the color of the circle.

This demo shows how the background side channel can operate while screen is on or off.

1. Draw off-screen and see your drawing.

2. Now switch to another app, or set the screen off - your drawing is still recorded.

1. Hover above the screen at different heights.

2. Use the switch to disable hovering.

3. Use the slider to set the maximum distance for the hovering events.

4. Pressing the side-buttons will change the color of the hover circle.

1. Please configure the SDP button to be the eraser button in the global settings.

2. Draw.

3. Set the eraser to "Tap to toggle". Press the eraser button. Erase. Pressing the erase button again, switches to pen mode.

4. Set the eraser to "Hold to erase". Now you can erase at immidiate touch.

5. Now use the eraser bypass switch to disable the eraser functionality.
Draw with the pen, and than with your finger.\nThe two methods are recgonized by different color.
